DataElement.preferredName: Adverse Event Performed Observation Outcome Resolution Date and Time ISO21090.TS.DATETIME.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date (and time) when the adverse event ends or returns to baseline.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Performed Observation Outcome Resolution Date and Time
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:Executed and carried through to completion.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action._Return to the normal structure and/or function, e.g. the subsidence of a pathologic process, as the subsidence of an inflammatory lesion or new growth.:An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:Executed and carried through to completion.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
Executed and carried through to completion.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.

Property.preferredDefinition: Return to the normal structure and/or function, e.g. the subsidence of a pathologic process, as the subsidence of an inflammatory lesion or new growth.:An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.

Concepts.definition: Return to the normal structure and/or function, e.g. the subsidence of a pathologic process, as the subsidence of an inflammatory lesion or new growth.
An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Constrains TS so that it's precision can not be more precise than seconds.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happened. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.
